data.title: central European time.
data.meta_description: Erm, I'm a bit confuddled here. Could anyone explein to me how CET relates to our current, British Summer, time?
data.text:
Erm, I'm a bit confuddled here. Could anyone explein to me how CET relates to our current, British Summer, time?

I found this on wikipedia

Central European Time (CET), used in most of Europe, is one of the names of the time zone that is 1 hour ahead of Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), with a time offset of UTC+1 (in winter).

Most European countries have adopted the use of Central European Summer Time (CEST) daylight saving time in summer, with UTC+2.

Which has just confused me even more to be honest.

So, if I'm in in British Summer time, and, let's just say for example, that a well known downhill race is being broadcast at 14:00 CET, what time is that in britain?

Are they ahead of us by one or two hours?

0
